main event: A ground visual observation of a single unidentified object in the Texas, New Mexico, Arizona area in January 1949 by military and multiple civilian sources.
interesting points: The observation lasted only a few seconds, indicating a brief but impactful encounter.
The source of the report includes both military and civilian witnesses, lending credibility to the sighting.
The conclusion classifies the object as an 'Astro (Green Fireball)', hinting at a potential natural or atmospheric explanation.
Physical evidence was not documented, despite the presence of photographs.
The report indicates that there may be a more detailed case file with additional information.
